summary: Product roadmap review with Rachel. She shared upcoming feature priorities for Q2. Very positive on our new batch processing capabilities. She offered to champion an internal case study.
Technical architecture deep-dive with Alex and Jordan. Discussed scaling plan for 10x traffic growth. Alex confirmed budget allocation for next quarter. Jordan asked about migration tooling.
Quick sync with Jordan on integration timeline. His team can start the POC next sprint. Needs sandbox environment access for 5 engineers.
Chris sent over his internal demo recording and feedback doc. 15 feature requests compiled from his team. Highlighted analytics dashboard as top priority.
Pricing discussion with Kevin. He's comparing our per-query pricing vs competitor's flat rate model. Needs a custom proposal showing volume discount tiers for his projected usage.
Technical evaluation review with Maya. She completed her benchmark tests. Our API latency is 40% better than competition. Raised concerns about SDK documentation for edge cases.
Taylor submitted feature request for custom report templates. Also flagged data export formatting issues with CSV files. Forwarded to product team.
Pricing breakdown call with Marcus. He wants to model three scenarios: current usage, projected growth, and peak capacity. Sending him our pricing calculator spreadsheet.
Sent SOC2 Type II report and data processing addendum to Emma. She acknowledged receipt but hasn't provided feedback yet. Follow up needed.
Nina reported issues with error codes during her POC. Specifically, 429 rate limit errors not returning proper retry-after headers. Escalated to engineering.

QBR meeting with Sarah and Alex. Brief interaction with CFO - she asked pointed questions about cost predictability and competitor pricing. Alex presented usage growth metrics. Sarah seemed cautious but not opposed.

Initial legal review with David. He raised concerns about data handling, cross-border transfers, and liability clauses. Wants custom DPA terms. His tone was adversarial - need to bring our legal counsel next time.
Intro meeting with James. Very process-oriented. Walked through their vendor evaluation framework. 12-step process. Emphasized need for security team sign-off before procurement can proceed.
Brief email intro with Lisa about billing workflows. She asked if we support PO-based billing and NET60 terms. Need to confirm with our finance team.
Email exchange with Amanda about their procurement timeline. She mentioned Q1 is typically when they finalize vendor renewals. Sent her our standard vendor questionnaire responses.
Brief chat with Sam at team lunch. He's interested in our design system integration but didn't go deep. More of a social introduction.
Quick Slack message from Alex sharing internal feedback survey results. 87% satisfaction rate among current users. He's using this data to build the business case for expansion.
Product feedback session with Rachel and Chris. Discussed upcoming API v2 features. They're excited about streaming support and function calling. Rachel wants to be a design partner for the beta.
